definition: Qian Qichen (1928-2017), former Chinese vice premier
surname Qian
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
precious stone/gem

sentences.english: Now, I would like to invite Vice Premier Qian Qichen to make a speech.
sentences.chinese: 下面，请钱其琛副总理讲话。

sentences.english: The station in South America will be set up in 2016, Qian said.
sentences.chinese: 在南美洲站将设于2016年，钱其琛说。

sentences.english: He went on to say that the practice to control others is against the will of the international community.
sentences.chinese: 钱其琛指出，在国际上控制别人的做法是不得人心的。

definition: Jiang Zemin (1926-), politician, president of PRC 1993-2003
Hu Jintao (1942-), General Secretary of the CCP 2002-2012, president of the PRC 2003-2013
Qiao Guanhua (1913-1973), PRC politician and diplomat
Hua Guofeng (1921-2008), leader of Chinese Communist Party after the Cultural Revolution
Sha Zukang (1947-), Chinese diplomat
Zhu Rongji (1928-), PRC politician, premier 1998-2003
Li Zhaoxing (1940-), former PRC foreign minister
Li Lanqing (1932-), PRC politician
Tung Chee-hwa (1937-), Hong Kong entrepreneur and politician, chief executive 1997-2005
Qiao Shi (1924-2015), Chinese politician
Chen Xiangmei (1925-2018), a.k.a. Anna Chennault, born in Beijing, US Republican Party politician, wife of Claire Lee Chennault 陳納德|陈纳德[Chen2 na4 de2]
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Rong Yiren (1916-2005), PRC Vice President from 1993-1998, played an important role in opening Chinese economy to Western investors
Tang Jiaxuan (1938-), politician and diplomat
Zhang Dejiang (1946-), PRC politician
Yang Jiechi (1950-), Chinese politician and diplomat, foreign minister of PRC 2007-2013
